website_summaries.verdict: An affordable bowl in a foldable design that makes it easy to carry anywhere.
pros: Includes 3 collapsible nylon bowls at a low price point
Nylon fabric is sealed for a leak-proof drinking experience
Bowl is easy to clean and dries quickly
Bowl folds up flat to fit inside your pocket
cons: Bowl opening is on the smaller side, may not be the best for larger dogs

website_summaries.verdict: A solid, space-saving option at an affordable price tag.
pros: Dog owners say this is easy to store and lightweight yet durable
We like it's space-saving design and the fact that it's so portable for travel
It's larger size also makes it great for bigger dogs
cons: Tends to leak if water is left in the bowl
needs to be on a flat surface

customer_reviews.title: Small or Medium (pick the Medium)
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5.4lbs chihuahua. After reading reviews I was still struggling with getting the small or medium. I ended up purchasing the medium. It's perfect. She can sit up and look around or lay down and take a nap. I love that the side are mesh so she can still see out while laying down. I added her favorite blanket to the bottom and she jumps in it herself. Great for our upcoming camping trip for when she gets tired on hikes. Posted some pictures so you can see bag and dog size.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous find!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Well made and our 12 lb mutt fits nicely in the medium. He loves it and falls asleep when we are carrying him. I thought this would a better choice than the carriers where their legs hang out. So glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Go Navy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walk, Great for Biking as a Backpack, not good for Front Facing Biking
customer_reviews.text: BIKING: It is perfect to bike with my dog on my back only. Forward facing for bike won't work, since there is not much support to hold my dog inside the bag. Also, it gets super hot inside the bag and this made my dog a little upset and also made me almost melt. I fixed the problem by getting a cooler pad which I placed between her and my back. WALKING: I love this product, absolutely great for walkings, both for front and back facing. My dog is a 12lb Chihuahua/Boston Mix.
customer_reviews.author: CmgGJ

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Serves it's purpose. It's a collapsible water dish that you can fold up and stick in your pocket. When placed upside down on a Cabbage Patch doll, it doubles as an ugly chef's hat.
customer_reviews.author: Unbiased

customer_reviews.title: Awesome carrier!!
customer_reviews.text: I made this video review to show you the size guys,my dog Tofu is a 3lbs teacup Maltese and he loves it!!I would say the small size is good for max 5 lbs..I also made one more video when I try it out on the street with my dog in it, check it out on youtube just search "kyjen outward hound pet carrier" on youtube ,here is the link [...] ..I definitely recommend this product it's comfortable and nice ..I tried it on my rats too but they climb out ,might work with male rats and other small pets cause they calmer,my girls are escapers..lol ps I don't know why I said oatward not outward,lol my bad..:)
customer_reviews.author: Ice

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This bag truly is excellent. The only thing that I wish it had was a few more pockets (maybe on the sides) for supplies. However, my dog really likes it, it's well-made, and it looks great. I don't think you should carry more than 10-15 lbs in it, though. My dog is 10 lbs and he feels pretty heavy in there, not to mention snug.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Klopp

customer_reviews.title: bag falls off
customer_reviews.text: The plastic clip on the back of the pouch comes off every time I walk my dog after a couple of times sticking my hand in and out of the bag. The plastic clip that attaches to your belt is poorly designed. The bag falls off your the clip. Save your money and try another one. You will see what I am talking about if you buy it. If they would fix that, it would be 5 stars. Kinda the most important function.
customer_reviews.author: schoolie

customer_reviews.title: CLIP ISN'T SEWN ONTO BAG
customer_reviews.text: The clip isn't part of the bag!!! It's a cheap plastic thing that slides into a little cutaway, not sewn into the bag or otherwise a part of the bag. I tried to reach in on the first day and the whole bag fell off my pants because the clip had separated from the bag. Now it's day 3 and no one can find the clip. Suspect it fell off again this time unknowingly and my dog ate it. Now all I have is a bag. No different than the plastic bag the treats came in as far as functionality. I don't know why this thing has so many purchases. Total rip off.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carrier.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my 4 pound chihuahua, Holly, and it works perfect. No complaints. Very comfortable being worn both front and backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen E.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It serves it's purpose. Kind of dorky but works. Bottom is solid for her to sit on. I ordered a medium. My pug is 12 pounds. She is not as tall as some pugs. Maybe that's why she fits. It could be a little deeper but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Guppie

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for Small Cats
customer_reviews.text: This works well for one cat, they can't jump out because it doesn't give them proper footing for it and being held close makes them feel safe. My only problem is now both of my kittens want to be carried at the same time and they don't fit. If you have 2 bonded animals and hike alone, don't get your hopes up : ). Works for my 6 pound kitten (pictured) and my 8 pound kitten.
customer_reviews.author: xxxxxxxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Went from small to medium and just as happy!
customer_reviews.text: I had the small outward hound front carrier when my dog was a puppy... i have upgraded her to the medium and i love it just as much as the small version. My dog is comfortable and I am comfortable ! My yorkie is only 4 lbs but I have always wanted her to have more room than required. She can lay down in here and see out the sides! One happy Dog
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie smith

customer_reviews.title: Quick drinking bowl
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a pack for my dog to carry when we're on long trips, and also needed a bowl. He knows how to drink out of water containers but we don't always want a dogs mouth all over something we might be drinking out of as well. This can be collapsed and rolled up small, and works well for what it's supposed to. As mentioned in other reviews, this is not meant for holding water for long periods. Put some water in, let the dog drink, empty it and repack. Works fine for that. We have a 65lb Samoyed and it works for him.
customer_reviews.author: A. KoubaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't need perfectly waterproof bowls
customer_reviews.text: Great collapsible bowls for camping/hiking. Lightweight and easy to pack in a small space or clip to a backpack while hiking. My only issue was that water leaks if left in the bowl for more than a few minutes. So, just keep that in mind while camping. The leaking ended up making my picnic table seat soaked before I noticed that issue. If you plan on leaving water in the bowl, just put it someplace where leakage won't be a problem. When driving I would just toss any remaining water after my dog drank. Otherwise a good value and easy to just throw in the laundry to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Fails at the most basic thing. Stay in your belt.
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is ok, good material and nice color, and the price is nice too. However, it's useless. I bought the bag, in order to have quick access to threats, as I train my dog. The clip that's suppose too hold the bag, is loose and easily falls when you reach pinto the bag. Apparently, everybody had similar feedback. If you're going to use the bag indoor, for a small pup, without lots of "stress", it may work, but for a few extra bucks, I rather get a bag that I don't risk losing every time I use.
customer_reviews.author: Raul HAV

customer_reviews.title: Falls off, the clip is not long enough and makes for handling treats outside impossible.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't really good for when you're on the go. The clip that is suppose to go over a belt or in a pocket does not hold well at all and will fall off, it slouches over and can twist easy making the treats fall out. This has made it difficult handling treats while trying to train my dog outside which I assume was the purpose of this bag(to be able to handle treats with ease), if the clip were the size of the bag then this wouldn't be an issue. I will be getting another pouch for outside and just keep this one for indoors. Pretty disappointed to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey W.

customer_reviews.title: best purchase for my fur baby!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my almost 17 year old dachshund. He can't walk much anymore, but loves to go for walks in his backpack. He weighs 15 # but it is not too heavy because of the waist and chest straps. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wetzell

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier!
customer_reviews.text: We love it so far! I have a mini dachshund and she is about 6 lbs now. I bought a Medium and she fits great! She can sit inside and curl up but she likes to poke her head out and look around as were walking. I haven't worn the carrier for a long time yet, but once you have it adjusted right it fits good! You have to unbuckle the straps, put the straps over your arms, then cross the straps behind you and buckle. If you just wear it over your shoulders without crossing them in the back, the carrier won't be secure. We plan to use our carrier for walks, short hikes and fishing . Can't wait!
customer_reviews.author: IndayMarie

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and animal falls out.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. We purchased a medium and tried it on our size and weight appropriate 2 dogs (5 lbs/8 lbs.) and 1 cat (8lbs). It was too small for any of them and terribly uncomfortable. They kept falling out of the top despite being clipped in to their harness. The bag isn't big enough or well enough designed to hold in the upper torso. If you pull the drawstring to try to tighten it around them, you're tightening around their neck -- it's both ineffective uncomfortable. I would like to return mine, but sadly my housekeeper threw away the box.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Choose a Small for a 4-5 lbs Chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: I have a Chihuahua (4-5 lbs) and this small bag works. He sat in it right off no sweat. I figure he will curl up in the bottom eventually. I can't see using the Medium for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Allen Randorf

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for the right training pouch for what feels like years and this pouch is so very close to my ideal pouch. It is a bit too wide for my liking but it is very comfortable. Easy to get open and closed and prevents my sneaky pups from stealing from me. I like the zipper pocket for holding poop bags and it is large enough to hold a phone if you need it to. The clip for your belt seems unnecessary but the straps and loops for the waist buckle are very sturdy so I have given the product 4:5
customer_reviews.author: Becky Chiocca

customer_reviews.title: This was a very bad choice for my 6lb Chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: This was a very bad choice for my 6lb Chihuahua. I ordered the med and it fit him like a glove (not in a good way). I am a 5'2" female with a few xtra lbs. There was not enough adjustment in the straps to shorten them for a snug fit against my body. I ended up tying the ends of two straps around my waist in a knot but this was poor at best. There was no way the baggy fit would allow for any support for my back. I had to use my hands to hold it up. And, my dog hated it. I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I don't have to walk miles holding a plastic poop bag. It serves the purpose. Attaches easily to a leash. Make sure you wrap the strap up well because the first time I used it the bag of poop must have fallen out somewhere because when I got home to throw it in the garbage it was gone, oops! Since then it's been fine. I tend not to smell it in this bag too. I do take a clorax wipe and wipe out the bag after each use.
customer_reviews.author: BettyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Spent too much time trying to keep my puppy inside!
customer_reviews.text: The concept was great. I loved the idea of our puppy sweetly sitting sitting in the backpack and looking at the trail ahead of us. Unfortunately that was NOT the case. My 10 lb, 15 week old Cavapoo. felt squished in there. She just wanted to leap out. I was basically still holding her but at least the bulk of her weight was on the backpack and not on me. I spent too much energy trying to keep her restrained in there. It didn’t make for a comfortable walk and I can’t recommend it. Maybe Ok for a smaller or better behaved dog, but I actually think my dog is well behaved and was doing normal puppy behavior.
customer_reviews.author: PediatricianMom

customer_reviews.title: Great bag but is for really small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This would be great if my dog was tiny. I thought 12-14 lbs would be ok but it really isn't. That doesn't take away from the quality of the product. My dog is just too big for it. He's fine if I sit him in it but hold onto him with one hand, which is what I do. (a pain) Just keep in mind it is for really small dogs. 10lbs or less would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Overn

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13 year old chihuahua who just can't keep up anymore because of heart problems. Having 2 other dogs, it was too hard to try to carry her around and juggle 2 leashes when we went places. This carrier makes it so she doesn't have to stay home anymore. She gets to go out and see people and be social again! She's nice and comfy inside and it's comfortable for me to wear as well. I definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Simple product does what is needed
customer_reviews.text: Great little pouch to carry treats for walks or training sessions. Others have complained about the clip, but the one I received (June 2020) has been redesigned. It feels very sturdy and clips securely to a belt or waistband.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: My dog tried to jump out one too many times
customer_reviews.text: In theory this product is awesome and I wanted to love it so much. I got a medium for my 9 lb puppy before she had all her shots so we could still take her out. However, the top doesn't tighten enough that she multiple times was able to jump out (thankfully there is a safety clip to clip to her harness) this product is much better suited for a more docile dog. We ended up getting the top paw backpack for her that has mesh netting on the top so that there is no chance of her jumping out and hurting herself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and comfortable for both of us.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for a 6lb chihuahua. I got the medium. She likes riding in a bike basket, so she’s used to this. It’s lightweight and sturdy. It has a tether strap to attach to her harness. There is mesh on the sides so she won’t get too hot. The top is a drawstring with a clasp thing. The straps are adjustable. There’s a little zip pocket in front with an interior zip pocket for my keys and phone. The base of it is firm and doesn’t sag, so it sticks out a bit. Overall, a good carrier. She doesn’t have to ride on her tailbone like some front carriers; she can stand, sit naturally or lie down.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I love having this on my back
customer_reviews.text: I have a 11lb Toy Poodle and he fits really well in this. I love having this on my back, instead of the front as some carriers are. This one is really comfortable and I have used it on long hikes and walks with my dog (he has a hurt foot, so he can't walk long distances). This is great especially on trails that don't allow dogs! because the top zips up and no one knows he's in there. He does sink a little in it or I guess it concaves a little like some have mentioned, since it doesn't have a hard bottom, but he is still comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Wenzel's Wayside

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy was 3 lbs when I got him, and quickly was up to 7 lbs. I only used this once because he was so good at walking. The bottom does stick out quite a bit. The best thing is I figured out that I can use this as a car seat for him. Just put the straps threw the metal posts on head rest, wrap around the back of the seat to the front and hook onto carrier. It’s amazing and my puppy loves it. If you’ve priced car seats for puppies, you’ll defines appreciate this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely runs small compared to the product description
customer_reviews.text: I read through the reviews before purchasing this product and I wish I listened to them. This runs quite small compared to the description. I have an 18 pound Japanese spitz mix who is well within the stated measurements but when I placed her in the medium sized carrier, the drawstring came up to only half of her body. The bag is well constructed and can actually take her weight, but my main concern is that it does not keep enough of her body inside the bag such that it's a real risk for her to easily jump out. I wish they made a large size, and if they did, I would probably buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Backpack is falling apart
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is unraveling and falling apart. It was a great product while it stayed together. One of the straps started ripping off, so I sewed it back on. But then, the fabric pockets started unraveling at the seams, the actual straps started unraveling, etc. I know it's not because of weight, my dog is only 4lb. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nika B

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, size small is prob 5 lb max
customer_reviews.text: I got the small size for my 5 lb poodle. It is a perfect fit. If he was any larger it would be too small. The straps are very long. I might try to cut them and re-sew the ends to eliminate the excess. Construction seems high quality. The storage is very minimal. I bought the Amazon warehouse used/Very Good. I assume it was a return. It appeared new but clearly had been removed from the original packaging and then stuffed back in.
customer_reviews.author: Shockster

customer_reviews.title: worked but.....
customer_reviews.text: it worked for my 8 lb chihuahua but the string broke on one side, the area that you could use to tighten the closing, came all the way out of its casing, still works. I hiked with him being carried some of the way. I bought a medium based on the reviews. The small would have been a tight fit for him. I will not return it. I liked that it fit over both shoulders and could be helped by the board bottom with my hands. Other than the breakage, seemed like good construction.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: My pom loves this thing
customer_reviews.text: My 8 lb Pomeranian loves this thing. She has really bad hips and can't go for "walks" but she loves to go out and about. My adult son carries her for walks (and no he is apparently not embarrassed, lol) She is a full ball of fluff and fits into it nicely. She has never had any near misses or fallen out and the safety measures are top notch. If you have a small dog that cant get around this is a god send to keep your hands free and take them for walks. It is my second time to buy this product. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Odies mom

customer_reviews.title: It's portable and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Lets keep this simple: This thing will hold about 2 bottles of water. It easily fits in any pocket, even those super slim jeans you have to paint on. I've had it a couple months now and through rigorous carrying around, hot car sitting, and damp storage it's still going tough You can fill it about 3/4 of the way before you have to worry about your dog sloshing half of it out. Biggest downside is probably nooks/crannies I can see getting dirty requiring more than a quick rinse. Darn, I'm going to have to actually clean it once in a while. For the price, legit good product.
customer_reviews.author: KushielAOC

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 7lb chihuahua. He's really tiny but has very long legs, so he's not particularly safe in it if I can't get him to sit down, but when he sits in it (with a towel at the bottom for comfort - it's not soft without one) he seems very comfortable. I've taken him on errands and on the bus with it and it's so handy when he's calm enough to not try to get out of it. I had originally bought it for my 13lb chihuahua mix, and she was much too big for it. I wish it had more pockets though. The pocket in the front is kind of useless.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Bock

customer_reviews.title: Gave Our Boy His Last Days With Total Care and Attention
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pack, and my 4 pound yorkie loved it. He was 14 years old and this enabled me to take him on long walks with the rest of the pack. He lived out his last few months in his pack, with me every moment as I went through my day. Thank you Outward Hound for making Cojo's last days full of contact and love, as he rode around with his human. (and glimpsed the elusive countertops where food rained from the sky for 14 years.)
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My 7lb, 12+ year old chihuahua has a slipped disc in his neck and has trouble walking and trembles when he is in pain. I put him in the pouch and he incredibly calmed down in less than 5 minutes. I wasn't sure he would even want to stay in it! We've worn it around the house and just went around our neighborhood block twice. He didn't struggle, whine or yelp and completely relaxes in it and enjoys the ride. I'm so, so happy! This bag weighs almost nothing and is comfortable to wear. I have back issues and the crossover straps feel very strong and supportive. And you absolutely cannot beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: dog pack
customer_reviews.text: We like to take evening walks with our dogs. Our big guy does fine, but my tiny Yorkie runs out of steam long before we turn around. This is working our great! She can walk as far as she wants, and ride the remainder of the way. I don't have to shift her from arm to arm, my hands are free and she can just sit and relax. This is the second one I've purchased as the first one somehow had the straps chewed up. Nobody's admitting to it:|.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gast

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Against my better judgement, I bought the small because it was available faster, but it was too small for my 8-lb pup. She fits perfectly into it sitting down and started to fall asleep after just a few moment of putting it on, but I want one I can rollerblade with and will keep her sturdy. Felt like good quality, drawstring in the front and the safety clip included. I liked it so much that I will be returning and getting a larger one. The pocket in the front is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: V.V.

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our dog when we go on trips. They fold very small, but hold a lot of food/water. We are still sure to put the water dish on top of a math or towel because it does tend to create a lot of condensation, which makes the floor quite wet. If we're camping outside, that's not a problem. If you're doing an air b&b, it can become an issue. They are also the perfect thing for hiking. These fit easily into her backpack and we fill one up with the water she is carrying so she can stay hydrated. Well worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C. Annis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to wear.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked really great for taking our granddog on hikes. It is very comfortable to wear. I think the only thing that could have been better, is some form of cushion on the bottom of the pack for the dogs comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Side Stitch Magic

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my 5-lb Chihuahua. While it is ok when she is in it, it sucks if she wants to walk for a bit. It sticks out so far and is not flexible. When she is in the bag, if she is not attached to the back, so can easily slide out. There isn't any room for a water bottle or anything else and she doesn't seem super comfortable. I'd probably look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: C.Ranzau

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the best purchase I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best purchase I've made in a long time. I wasn't sure if my dog would like it since she freaks out in standard pet carriers, but she loves it! Makes taking her places so much easier! I have a medium and my dog is 5 lbs, but she is tall. She has plenty of room in it, so I wrap a blanket around her to keep her cozy. So wish I discovered this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Evans

customer_reviews.title: They are a good size for her head/mouth to fit in and drink
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take camping with us for the dog. I bought two, one for water and one for food. The material is heavy duty. I have used it twice, filled it all the way to the top with water and had no problems with leaking as other reviewers have had trouble with. I have a 40lb dog and bought the large. They are a good size for her head/mouth to fit in and drink. The reason I did not give 5 stars is because the opening cannot be sinched closed when I carry the food. She never eats all the food I pour in the bowl, so I cant pack the food to go in the bowl :-(
customer_reviews.author: Regan

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: lol - not even close to fitting an 20# dog.... Let alone my 13# jack.
customer_reviews.author: D Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Best pet purchase I've made
customer_reviews.text: This simple carrier has saved us! Our Yorkie Terrier did not want to be inside a carrier and yet we wanted to travel with him. I started using it around the house to get him use to it. Pop him in and give him a few treats while we walked around inside. Then used it when I took him hiking or long walks, starting him in the carrier and then on the way home if he was tired. Now he loves it. And the best news, I got a closed carrier with the same fabric, lots of visibility and he will go inside it without freaking out. It's really cheap and the best deal for pets on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fitzfox

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price, takes 2 people to get it on at first, fun to carry your pup around
customer_reviews.text: Vet said to make sure that the puppy does get some ground time to prevent muscle weakness in legs. But it is so fun to put them in this and carry them around. It took a little coordinating at first, but it gets easier as you get used to it. make sure to put pup in a harness and attach the safety strap to the harness (NEVER TO COLLAR in case they jump out, you don't want them to be hanging from the collar). Also works to attach them in the seatbelt to keep them safe if you don't have a pup carseat
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Way to Hold Your Smaller Dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this Saturday at an event & it was great! It was chilly out so I had a sweater & Christmas dress on my Yorkie then I zipped her into my winter jacket & wrapped her with a blanket. She was as snug as a bug in a rug!! Plus my arm didn’t ache for days, after holding 6 pounds of dead weight!! Highly recommend it for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Countrymom56

customer_reviews.title: Good bag if you want a front carrier
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this thinking that I was going to use it to carry my dog on my back. I thought it wouldn't matter that it was supposed to be a front carrier. Well, it turns out it matters because of the shape of the straps and how/where they're attached to the bag. No fault of the companies, it just wasn't what I was looking for and it got returned. It seemed well made and was a good size for my 6.5lb Chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: actuallythedog

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable “puppy pouch” that both my dog and I love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this “puppy pouch,” as I like to call it! My dog, Sparky goes with me just about everywhere! My mom wanted to buy me one after seeing someone using it. My dog absolutely loves being in it. There’s a padded cushion for him to sit on and it’s comfortable to wear. We had a family reunion in Mammoth this year. I attended for 3 days and this front carrier came in handy. Long walks/hikes were fun! When he got tired, I just placed him in it. There’s a clip that attaches to my dogs harness for safety so he won’t fall out. That’s one feature super important for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Neville

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase but wish it had a clip in the front...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Jack Russell. He’s about 12 pounds. This is perfect for him. The only issue I have is it feels like he’s going to fall forward out of it. I wish it a clip to close it instead of having the drawstring. It has a clip but the instructions say it’s for a harness. I’ve used it in the front and on my back. The back felt a little more secured but my dog likes to be in the front, watching everything. Overall it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and dog quickly gets addicted to being in it!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my 11-pound ball of fluff should really rate this. When he sees this coming, he wants to get into it. Not only does he like being closer to me, you can tell he likes his vantage-point view of everything. The instructions state that you should cross the straps over your back and buckle them in. I know some of the reviews stated to do that, but I'm glad the instructions actually state to do that to keep this secure. I'd definitely recommend it...or my dog would actually recommend it other fur-babies out there.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic carrier for my kitten
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made front pet carrier especially for the price. What an awesome deal! I bought the medium for my cat. He is a 3 1/2 month old kitten in the photo. I figure when he is full grown this will be a good size. This carrier is very comfortable and very stable with the shoulder straps and waist strap hooked up. So far my kitten likes this but be prepared to work with your pet so they are comfortable in it. I like the safety feature of having a clip inside it that I can connect to my kittens harness. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lostie4everTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made in China not USA, like it implies.
customer_reviews.text: This product is made in China. I looked all through the product page, looked up the company (because I don't trust Chinese products to be safe enough to eat off of) and it didn't say it was made in China. It said it was from Florida and shipped from Ohio. Very disappointed. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Far, far smaller than advertised
customer_reviews.text: The website says 15 lbs, the box says 20 lbs. If your dog is shaped like a 15-lb apple or even better a 15-lb bean bag, then maybe. I'm here to tell you, though, that this is a teeny weeny bag that does not fit a 15-lb dog that has legs. My dog (15 lb Lhasa mix) is just about as tall as the bag, standing next to it. If ever there were a need for a photo that shows this product next to something of standard size, it's here. A photo next to a brick, or banana, or book would be super helpful. I'm returning this, after my dog and I had a good laugh.
customer_reviews.author: Biker Dog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carrier with waist strap!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several different carriers for my 6 lb Yorkie and this one is Perfect! The shoulder straps are adjustable, the waist strap is what I've looked for and it holds the pouch in place. The safety strap is located inside to hook to the pets collar. My furbaby sits and also lays down very comfortably. Just FYI, I keep a couple of folded puppy pads and a baby blanket in the bottom for my pet to lay on. THIS has certainly been the best carrier I've purchased yet and I wish I'd tried it first! It's very well made, sturdy yet flexible to fold when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: GayleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a 10 pound Sheshawn-poodle like. 15 year , non over active dog so she stays in good. It can get alittle snug on neck from closure. She’s enjoys it. It’s well made and sturdy. We take her on hikes and Bike rides. She’s never fallen out and loves to be able to come along and sightsee. Love watching her little head looking side to side with a pleasant expression.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tiny teacup Yorkie.
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie weighs 1.9 pounds. This bag was perfect for her. I had to put extra padding in the bottom so her head would stick out of the top. She can lay down in the bag if she wants. A larger dog would have trouble laying down. The clip to secure her in the bag is sturdy. It's a great bag that makes it easier to carry her around as she goes almost everywhere with me.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but they don’t fold up or transport well. It’s not like you can put treats or food in them and go because there isn’t a way to close or seal these. If traveling or going for walks, the water and food has to go in separate bags or bottles then you can pour it in the pouch. It’s flimsy and truthfully not as easy as a small pouch is to carry. I think they’re a waste of money. You use them once, waste the water that’s left over then clean them every time which isn’t helpful to me.
customer_reviews.author: Idealist

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pooch pouch.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 5lb chihuahua for when we go on longer walks or to the farmers market or literally anywhere we take her because she prefers to be held and we prefer to have use of both our hands. Everyone who walks by has something to say about it, lol. It’s a tad too deep for her so we used a blanket or shirt to bump her up a bit, and then she has something to snuggle into if she gets a chill. The only thing we wish it had was cupholders!!! Please contact me if you create one with cupholders!! LOL but no we love this thing and use it several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Michaelree

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and sturdy design.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my older pup that can't walk very far so he can go on hikes and walks with us. He is a 10lb Dachshund and fit perfectly in this. I put a small blanket for him to sit on and he seemed comfortable! I wore it around my front and back, it's pretty comfortable either way.
customer_reviews.author: smashleylee

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT FOR YOUR FUR BABY
customer_reviews.text: My puppy Theodore Roosevelt loves to watch me work...Probably why he rips up paper... Theodore out grew his first carrier so I had to order another carrier so he can watch mommy wash dishes. The carrier has a flat square bottom, with strong soft straps for support...Theodore got into the carrier with no problem. I tightened the string around the top to secure him in than started cleaning. As long as Theodore Roosevelt is being held, I can get my work done! I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Works great, compact, bought like 6 so far
customer_reviews.text: I just put this on subscribe and save so I get one like every other month because I find that I like having them tucked everywhere so I never end up without a water dish for my doggo. Works great, easy to stash anywhere (I put it in his little canvas zippable poop bag holder, it fits in snugly with his poop bags, so I don't have to carry two things!), easy to use. LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver during a very long roadtrip. I purchased it knowing It would come in hand someday and I was correct. My dog loved being able to drink out of a portable bowl and when he finished I could toss it and take care of it later. Easy to use, portable and compact. Would recommend this for anyone going on long walks with their pets on hot days of keeping it in the car for when they need water service.
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: A life saver towards the end.
customer_reviews.text: A life saver for my little guy towards the end. I wouldn’t recommend for dogs over 15 pounds unless you lift weights or something, can hurt your back after a bit. I wish I’d have bought it sooner, it’s so much better than a stroller, safer feeling, I could keep my arm around him to ensure he doesn’t try to jump but really I think he just liked being that secure next to me. Would highly recommend for small to medium dogs.
customer_reviews.author: TracyMW7

customer_reviews.title: Great packable bowl
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for anytime I’m away from home and my dog needs water or food. It’s light weight and packs down small. I’ve clipped it to my dogs leash or harness when we go for walks on hot days.
customer_reviews.author: JXF

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our road trip, so held off on a review until I had a chance to use it. 1st it arrived on time before we left for our road trip which was great. folder nicely and worked well for travel. It did NOT which was a huge plus. I kept it with a little water on the floor board of the back seat and it did not leak, spill during the trip. The dogs had no problem drinking out of the bowl, it's compact and great for travel. Glad I purchased it to replace the one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Becky LeMaster

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I originally tried the k9 sports pack but it takes time to get my dog used to it. He really didn't like getting his front legs through that backpack and I knew I needed a backpack I can just plop him into. This one is perfect! He's 14lb and a little long and snuggles in so well. He's so happy in this one! So far it's comfortable for me as well. The cross straps and waist strap are great. It needs to be pretty tight to keep the dog upright but the clips make it easy to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Tran

customer_reviews.title: Love this carrier
customer_reviews.text: We bought probably 6 different carriers for our 8-pound dog and finally decided this one was the way to go and we couldn't be happier! We did purchase a strap that pulls the two arm straps together behind the back so you can lean forward and it doesn't feel like it's going to fly off the front of you. Other than that, this carrier is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Diane B

customer_reviews.title: TINY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bigger woman, I wear a 16 womens jean. The belt on this is only big enough for a child or VERY small person. My friends daughter can wear it she wears a size 5 womens jeans. Im very disapointed in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: I feel like he will fall out if I lean forward
customer_reviews.text: My little guy is 16 lbs, yes he's a little linger than your average dog, but he looks WAY too hig for this. Also i felt like he was leaning way forward the whole time. The straps felt like they were going to slide off, so I even tried them crisscross in the back. He did not feel comfortable at all in it, he is normally in a sling that he loves, but was looking for something a little different with pockets and easier on the shoulders. I will be returning this as it does not work for us at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl to take outdoors or while away from home ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bowl to take outdoors or while away from home when you want give your dog some water, dump the leftovers, and keep moving. It's not completely waterproof, so water tends to slowly seep through the bottom (which I learned the hard way makes a muddy mess when placed on dirt for a while haha), which keeps this from being a 5 star product. That doesn't mean we don't use it all the time though! Its collapsible design, light weight, and carrying loop make it easy to attach to or throw inside a backpack or bag.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Good bowl
customer_reviews.text: Nice size to put inside of a doggie vest. It isn't permanently waterproof but it's not meant to be...just something to put water or food in until your dog is done eating/drinking.
customer_reviews.author: Pete M

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dog backpack that has enough roomy outside pockets to carry all your hiking items so you don't need any additional bag! So lightweight and comfortable and the design is open and comfortable for your doggy. My dogs have been pretty good about not needing to be carried so even as a regular hiking backpack, it's excellent because the mesh and the way it opens from the top allows you to easily see all your stuff at once! And what a great deal pricewise - I highly recommend this bag! (My 7 lb Morkie was very happy in this the time I carried him in it.)
customer_reviews.author: Tech Girl

customer_reviews.title: Lol
customer_reviews.text: Bunny is 6 lbs and I bought the small. I use it when I don’t feel like lugging around her stroller (she’s an older girl and has heart problems). I know a lot of people go for the medium unless their dog is a teacup, but I’m glad I got the small, because she fits fine and it fits my frame better (I’m 5’9” and lanky). She gets excited when she sees me take it out now and it seems well made. For the 9 bucks I paid I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler F

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our 7
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our 7.5 lb maltese! She loves it. When she is sitting in it her head is out. She can lie down in it, too. What I love is that her harness safely clips safely to the pack. She is very secure (by being clipped into the pack) but still has the option to lie down, sit, or stand. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This is such a good little dog backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good little dog backpack! My dog is a senior terrier, and I love to take her hiking and camping with me, but she tends to get really tired on day two of any excursion. I take this with me now so she can ride in the pouch when she gets tired but can still be with me having adventures when she feels up to it :) definitely a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Drawstring broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The elastic drawstring snapped the very first time we used it. Unfortunately, it has been too long and I can’t return it. My other criticism is that the shoulder straps fall off your shoulders. I used a backpack to help keep it in place. The small was a good fit for my 7 pound chihuahua and he got used to the idea of riding in it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, better device
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My little 6 pound pup is getting used to sitting in it, but I feel rest assured that with the clip in the back connected to her, she is not falling out anywhere. I started Carrying her around in a sling type initially, but was fearful using it without always having hands continually on her. With this carrier I can go on with my day, and she's happy to be accompanying me instead of staying home. So there is freedom and love, all in one. Great device and would definitely recommend it. Also, love the little pocket in front, to put a small leash and doggie baggies in. Made of great quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Schlauch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bag for my 9 lb chihuahua. The first bag lasted 6 years with heavy use as I walk at least 5 miles per day on the beach with my chihuahua on my back! Perfect bag as it’s extremely light and easy to use. My dog loves it. The bottom is firm so she can sit comfortably and see everything! Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and comfortable for doggie and human
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect back pack for my 12 pounds Shihtzu! It felt very comfortable for both human and doggie. Medium is perfect for her, if she is any heavier or bigger, it probably won’t fit. She doesn’t seem to mind staying in it but it fits better if she "sits". I like the safety feature to "lock" her in with a hook to her harness, so I won't worry about her falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Jean K. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Larger size than expected
customer_reviews.text: I do like this, it’s just a lot bigger and bulkier than I had thought it would be. Used it for about a month and then found a smaller version. 4 stars only due to size. Quality is great, features are awesome, I liked that it all other than it was just too long and flopped around in the leash. Will try to update with photos later.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Goodell

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for a 14 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this product. It claims that dogs up to 20 pounds can fit comfortably. My 14 pound Yorkie can't. He is a bit too husky for this one. I really think a smaller dog would fit quite nicely. We wound up finding a much better fit for our hiking and vacationing needs for our dog at Petsmart. I wish this one had worked. It just wasn't a good match for us. We tried several times to adjust it and it wasn't sturdy enough for our fur baby and our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Sutterfield

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: After my previous treat tote broke I bought this. The belt clip on the one I received does attach fully to the bag (unlike some of the other reviews where the clip attachment to the bag is more of a "hook" that comes off). Not sure if that's how they now manufacture it now, or if you get the luck of the draw. I clip it to my pants/pants pocket and it works fine. Has some resistance to when you try to open the drawstring with one hand, but I'd rather have that issue than the treats falling everywhere. Easy to get my hand in the bag to pull out treats.
customer_reviews.author: Noveltea

customer_reviews.title: Poorly fit
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware of the reviews. Based on the previous reviews, and sellers list of dogs this would fit, I purchased this in a medium. Way too large for my doggie. If I return, I pay postage, not worth the $6 back.
customer_reviews.author: kelleysdiy

customer_reviews.title: More conveinent than a dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly more conveinent than packing/carrying a dog bowl, but if using this for water, just like softsided coolers, over time, the interior of the bowl will spring a leak, promoting mold growth between the walls of the container. The collapsible/packable silicone dishes don't harbor mold growth. I still use this for dry food, but always silicone for wet contents.
customer_reviews.author: Penny PincherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Clip Needs Redesign
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a great value. The price is more than fair. My only complaint is the plastic bag clip that is poorly designed and the bag falls off every training session or walk. I live in Texas and wear shorts most of the time. The clip has a gap, I guess for easier attachment to the bag. There should be no gap as there is already a velcro strap that easily slips through the clip. My dogs trainer uses the same bag and had the same problem. She just superglued it in place. It would cost the manufacturer next to nothing to make a very simply improvement.
customer_reviews.author: TexasEskimo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing failure
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these and unfortunately after only a few uses the waist strap has ripped and can no longer be used. Very disappointing since we hike and take our dog everywhere we sometimes need to put her in this to shop in stores where pets are allowed but it is now useless. There is no reinforcement on the waist strap and no way to fix it! So sorry this didn't work will have to look at other brands now.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Finally a carrier I can carry
customer_reviews.text: The front carrier makes it easy to take my little shih tzu in and out, arrange things inside and I feel I have more control when walking. My pup never felt comfortable being carried at the back, she was always stiff which made me uneasy. With this one she can sit in it and rest her head on the side. Happy :)
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for purse dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this. I think it's made more for a small dog. I bought for puppy, but he grew too fast to fit in it. He's a 15 ll. Rat Terrier, & never got use to sitting in it. He would stand in it. He could easily jump out as well. I think for a different breed, that's more mellow than mine, this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a service dog who I carry everywhere so I’ve got quite a few carriers, all of them a lot more expensive and this one is my favorite and most comfortable for her. Easy to get her in and out of and comfortable to carry. My baby is 9 pounds. Well built and well designed. It has a front pocket that is nice but it would be better if there were 1 or 2 side pockets
customer_reviews.author: Becky wilson

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a 15 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in medium for my 15 pound miniature poodle, thinking it would be really helpful on walks because she loves them but gets sores on her feet sometimes and she doesn't tolerate any kind of boot or sock. It's solidly built and I wish I could keep it, but she doesn't fit! She is on the smaller end of miniature poodles, and this pack fits only about 3/4 of her body even when she is situated properly in it. Wish it came in a bigger size!
customer_reviews.author: Azriel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 13lb dog. I ordered the medium and she fits just right. If your dog is any bigger than 13lbs it might not fit. I wish this had a pocket for a water bottle but it does have a small packet for doggy poop bags. The bottom is sturdy allowing my dog to sit comfortably. So far we have used this bag for our bike rides. It seems better to wear in the back. In the front it has the tendency to fall forward.
customer_reviews.author: Kester

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and comfortable to use. We got our puppy when she was 3.5 lbs and she was comfortable nestled inside the bag. She has grown to 7 lbs and we still use it. She is supposed to get around 10 -11 lbs...not sure how she'll fit at that weight. Poppy is a Havana Silk...but so far she's happy. When we're out shopping, she generally sits up with her head popping up out of the top. My wife also made a soft, foam rubber tube to go around the top rim of the pouch, so Poppy can easily rest her head on with no 'trachea' issues. The bag itself is sturdy...we're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DST

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for leaving in the car
customer_reviews.text: We've had a few impromtu drives with the dog in tow only to forget a bowl for the dog to drink out of... so these are great! They are small and compact and perfect for leaving in the vehicle for 'just in case'. Easy to clean and so far they have held up great. And the price was so great that I bought multiples so we can have one in each of our vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Ford GalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The problem is the size, my dog is 7 pounds and the Medium bag was too small for him. I hoped that he will be able to lie down, he is sitting in a uncomfortable position. Another issue is that the strap to attach on the harness is cheap plastic which can easily brake if the dog decides to jump out of the carrier. The overall quality of the carrier is fair it would work best for dogs that are under 5 pounds, which is kind of a bummer considering the company claims that it will fit a dog up to 15 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reading a few reviews I was nervous about getting this for my dog. Only because it seemed like there was some not so happy about the way their dogs fit. My Yorkie is 9 pounds and fit in it perfect. He can sit up or curl up and sleep. I haven't used it yet other than walking around the house so far, but I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KHG77

product_meta.title: Outward Hound, Lightweight Dog Backpacks, Carriers & Pet Travel Products
product_meta.description: Style:Port A Bowl| Size:One-Size| Color:GreenThe collapsible Port A Bowl tucks easily into a backpack, pocket, or purse and provides an easy way to give your dog food and water while on the go. Explore new ground with Outward Hound Gear! Our high-quality performance gear will keep your pup safely equipped for every new adventure!
feature_bullets: FOLDS FLAT: This portable dog bowl folds flat to fit into your dog’s backpack, your backpack or your pocket making for easy feeding on-the-go.
DRIES FAST: We know our dogs like to get up and go. When feeding and drinking are over, The Outward Hound Port A Bowl dries fast so it can be packed away without worry.
HOLDS FOOD AND WATER: Great for food and water, this dog bowl is leak resistant and holds your pup’s food when you’re away from home.
LIGHTWEIGHT: Travel ready and compact for easy carry or storage
BUILT TOUGH: Rugged nylon construction for added durability

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
